page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: Nearly ninety per cent of the area is farmland and the majority of the farms are now quite large.{Sir Francis {Winnington}of Shelsley Beachamp owns much of the land to the east of the B 4204 between Clifton-on-Teme and Sapey Common.This land is farmed by {tennant farmers}and there is an increasing tendency for traditional farmhouses to be sold as private dwellings leaving the land to be farmed by one of the major tennant farmers.The{Steps Farm}on the edge of Clifton Village and the{Field House}at Upper Sapey are recent examples of this.There are still farms which have been run by well established families for many years and names such as {Yeomans,Edwards}and{Carpenter}are likely to be part of the local farming scene for many years.
